summary: This is an email chain from October 30, 2019, discussing media coverage of forensic pathologist Dr. Michael Baden's findings regarding Jeffrey Epstein's death. The emails show internal coordination to downplay Baden's conclusion that Epstein's injuries were more consistent with homicide than suicide.

persons.name: Michael Baden
persons.context: Dr. Baden is referenced as having told Fox News that his findings regarding Jeffrey Epstein's death are more consistent with strangulation than suicidal hanging.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the forensic analysis; his death is being discussed as either a homicide or suicide.

connections.description: Dr. Baden conducted a forensic analysis of Jeffrey Epstein's death.

events.title: Media Report on Epstein Death Findings
events.description: Forensic pathologist Dr. Michael Baden tells Fox News his findings on Jeffrey Epstein's death are more consistent with strangulation than suicide.

keyFacts: On October 30, 2019, forensic pathologist Dr. Michael Baden publicly stated his findings on Jeffrey Epstein's death were more consistent with homicide by strangulation than suicidal hanging.
Internal email correspondence shows an effort to downplay or 'tamp down' public reaction to Baden's findings, describing them as 'bunk' and suggesting the source is 'controversial'.
The document reveals internal coordination among unnamed officials or attorneys to manage media inquiries and public perception regarding the controversial circumstances of Epstein's death.
